Text: 733 seeds and no comments?? how's the quality on this you ungrateful fucks?!?

Marcel Marx, ex-renowned writer and bohemian, voluntarily went into exile in the port city of Le Havre where his craft honorable but unremunerative shoeshine gives the feeling of being closer to the people by serving him. He is survived by his literary ambition and leads a good life in the triangle formed by the pub on the corner, his work and his wife Arletty, when fate suddenly puts on its way an immigrant child from Africa Black. When at the same time, Arletty falls seriously ill and must stay in bed Marcel must again fight the cold wall of human indifference Armed only with his innate optimism and solidarity stubborn people in his neighborhood. He faces the mechanics of a blind state of Western law, represented by the vice police who tightens more on the refugee boy. It's time for Marcel to shine his shoes and show the teeth.
